1.text: And Jehovah will speak to Moses, saying,

2.text: Make to thyself two trumpets of silver; turned work shalt thou make them: and they were to thee for calling the assembly and for the removing the camp.

3.text: And they sounded with them, and they assembled to thee all the assembly at the door of the tent of appointment.

4.text: And if they shall sound with one, and to thee assembled the chiefs of the heads of the thousands of Israel.

5.text: And ye sounded the signal, and the camps encamping eastward, removed.

6.text: And ye sounded the signal the second time, and the camps encamping to the south, removed: they shall sound the signal for their removings.

7.text: And in the assembly being gathered together, ye shall sound, and shall not sound loud.

8.text: And the sons of Aaron, the priests, shall sound with the trumpets; and they were to you for a law forever to your generations.

9.text: And when ye shall go out to war in your land against the enemy pressing you, and ye sounded the signal in the trumpets; and ye were remembered before Jehovah your God, and ye were saved from your enemies.

10.text: And in the day of your gladness, and in your appointments, and in the heads of your mouths, and ye shall sound with the trumpets over your burnt-offerings and over the sacrifices of your peace; and they were to you for a remembrance before your God: I am Jehovah your God.

11.text: And it shall be in the second year, in the second month, in the twentieth of the month, the cloud was taken up from the dwelling of testimony.

12.text: And the sons of Israel will remove for their departure from the desert of Sinai; and the cloud will dwell in the desert of Paran.

13.text: And they will remove first, at the mouth of Jehovah, by the hand of Moses.

14.text: And the flag of the camp of Judah will remove first according to their army: and over his army, Nashon, son of Amminadab.

15.text: And over the army of the tribe of the sons of Issachar, Nethaneel, son of Zuar.

16.text: And over the army of the tribe of the sons of Zebulon, Eliab, son of Helon.

17.text: And the dwelling was taken down, and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari removed, lifting up the dwelling.

18.text: And the flag of the camp of Reuben removed according to their army, and over his army, Elizur, son of Shedur.

19.text: And over the army of the tribe of the sons of Simeon, Shelumiel, son of Zurishaddai.

20.text: And over the army of the tribe of the sons of Gad, Eliasaph, son of Deuel.

21.text: And the Kohathites removed, lifting up the holy place, and they raised up the dwelling till their coining.

22.text: And the flag of the camp of the sons of Ephraim removed according to their army, and over his army, Elishama, son of Ammihud.

23.text: And over the army of the tribe of the sons of Manasseh, Gamaliel, son of Pedahzur.

24.text: And over the army of the tribe of the sons of Benjamin, Abidan, son of Gideoni.

25.text: And the flag of the camp of the sons of Dan removed, bringing up the rear to all the camps according to their army: and over his army, Ahiezer, son of Ammishaddai.

26.text: And over the army of the tribe of the sons of Asher, Pagiel, the son of Ocran.

27.text: And over the army of the tribe of the sons is of Naphtali, Ahira, son of Enan.

28.text: These the departures of the sons of Israel according to their army, and they shall remove.

29.text: And Moses will say to Hobab, son of Raguel the Midianite, father-in-law of Moses, We are removing to the place which Jehovah said, I will give it to you: come thou with us, and we did good to thee; for Jehovah spake good concerning Israel.

30.text: And he will say to him, I will not go; but to my land, and to my kindred I will go.

31.text: And he will say, Thou shalt not leave us now, for upon this thou knewest we encamped in the desert, and thou wert to us for eyes.

32.text: And it being when thou shalt go with us, it being that which Jehovah will do good with us and we did good to thee.

33.text: And they will remove from the mountain of God, a way of three days: and the ark of the covenant of Jehovah removed before them, a way of three days, to search out for them a rest.

34.text: And the cloud of Jehovah upon them the day in their removing out of the camp.

35.text: And it shall be in removing the ark Moses will say, Rise, Jehovah, and thine enemies shall be scattered; and they hating thee shall flee from before thee.

36.text: And in its encamping, he will say, Turn back, Jehovah, to the ten thousand thousands of Israel.
